sentence.Network_en: They downplay, or justify, the proliferation of white supremacist - tinged paramilitary groups, police violence, and racial profiling.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们对带有白人至上主义色彩的准军事组织的数量猛增以及警察暴力和种族倾向轻描淡写, 并为它们辩护.

sentence.Network_en: But not all white supremacist leaders are mindful of their actions or care to be.
sentence.Network_cn: 但并非所有白人优越主义的头目都留意或在意他们自己的行为.

list.abs: ...会主义者(national-socialist)或白人至上主义者(white supremacist)的婉转称呼。
一些翻译~（转的~） ... Utopian 空想家 white supremacist 白种人优越论者 apparatus 机构.
...的博客中写到,切莉·戴维斯指责美国速滑队队员奉行“白人至上”(white supremacists)并有种族歧视.
...述这些组织，性质不一，它的实践强度也不一。从前长期以来，无论学者、媒体或情治系统，皆将这些组织称为「白种优越主义者」（white supremacists），显然太过简化，例如差不多的激进信仰者都有「民兵组织」（posse comitatus），但三K党的.

entry.tran: 种族优越论者; (通常指)白人至上主义者
entry.def: A supremacist is someone who believes that one group of people, usually white people, should be more powerful and have more influence than another group.

example.ex: ...a plot by White supremacists to blow up a Black church in Los Angeles.
example.tran: 白人至上主义者试图炸毁洛杉矶一所黑人教堂的阴谋
一个白人至上主义者组织

means.word_mean: 1. a person who advocates the supremacy of some particular group over all others
